messages.content: ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper is a set of nodes for ComfyUI that allows users to animate open-domain still images using text prompts with pre-trained video diffusion priors.

To install ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper, you can either install it from git or clone the repo to custom_nodes and run the required pip installs. For those using the portable version, this can be done from the ComfyUI_windows_portable folder.
What are the GPU memory and inference time requirements for the DynamiCrafter model?

On an RTX 4090 GPU, the DynamiCrafter model with a resolution of 576x1024 requires 18.3GB of GPU memory, and 320x512 requires 12.8GB. The inference time is approximately 10 seconds for an NVIDIA A100 (40G) GPU for a single frame animation.
Can I use xformers with ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper?
Yes, you can use xformers with ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper, and it is recommended to use xformers if possible to reduce memory usage.
What models can I use with ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper?

ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper supports models with different resolutions such as DynamiCrafter1024 (576x1024), DynamiCrafter512 (320x512), and DynamiCrafter256 (256x256) as well as DynamiCrafter512_interp for generative frame interpolation and looping video generation.
How do I run ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper for inference?

To run ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper, you can use the provided scripts in the repository. For image-to-video generation, you can run the script for the desired resolution, and for generative frame interpolation/looping video generation, you can run the corresponding script.
What community extensions are available for ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper?
ComfyUI is a community extension available for ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper, offering a GUI for generating images and videos using a stable diffusion model.
What is the DynamiCrafter model used for?
The DynamiCrafter model is used for animating open-domain still images based on text prompts, leveraging pre-trained video diffusion priors.
Can I use ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper for commercial purposes?
No, the repository is developed for research purposes and can only be used for personal/research/non-commercial purposes.
